pageContext.claim: “I think the President [of Turkey] has a great relationship with the Kurds. Many Kurds live currently in Turkey. And they're happy and they're taken care of, including healthcare -- we were talking about it before -- including healthcare and education and other things.”
pageContext.analysis: Many Kurds do live in Turkey but that doesn't mean the Kurdish population has an easy relationship with the Turkish government. Kurdish populations have been heavily suppressed for decades. Mustafa Kemal Ataturk, the founder of Turkey, worked to systematically	erase Kurdish identity through decades of killings and displacement.
